page.title: 09Banwell Education 1911-1985
page.content: In 1911 the Board of Education disapproved of the High Street building on grounds of insufficient "sanitary" and "play" arrangements. In 1912 the County Council proposed building new premises and took over the school in 1923, as the Church of England managers could not provide funds for necessary alterations. The school moved into the present building in 1926. Between 1949 to 1957 the school became a Primary School rather than an all age one. Over the last twenty years numbers have increased and mobile classrooms have been added. Technology has come into the school with television, videos and computers. The School Log Books dating back to 1863 have been microfilmed so that future generations can read about the happenings at Banwell School.
